translation.text: Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line - Major delays

Major delays continue to services in both directions due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Mortdale earlier. 

A reduced service is operating between Sutherland and Hurstville. A regular service continues to operate between Hurstville and the City. A shuttle train service will operate in both directions between Cronulla and Sutherland and between Waterfall and Sutherland to provide a regular service. You may need to change at Sutherland to continue your journey

If you are travelling from stations between Mortdale, Cronulla and Waterfall towards the City we recommend delaying your journey or making alternative arrangements. If you must travel please plan ahead, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for service updates

Buses continue to replace trains between Wollongong and Kiama in both directions following an incident involving a train and a car at Kembla Grange station.

Trains between Port Kembla, Wollongong and the City continue to operate.

It is expected the line will reopen for the start of Monday morning train services. so we recommend delaying your journey or making alternative travel arrangements. If you must travel please plan ahead and allow plenty of extra travel time, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for updates.

Trains have been suspended and replaced by buses between Moss Vale and Campbelltown in both directions due to severe weather conditions affecting infrastructure at various locations.

There is no forecast for the re-opening of the rail line and recommend customers delay their journey or make alternative arrangements.

If you must travel please plan ahead, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for service updates

Club Cup Day - The Everest Carnival, Royal Randwick Racecourse, Randwick.
Gates open 11:00. First race 12:30. Last race 18:10
- The closest station to Royal Randwick Racecourse is Central.
- Change at Central for Light rail services to Royal Randwick on the L2 Line leaving from Chalmers Street. You can also catch the light rail to Kensington on the L3 Line to get within walking distance of the racecourse.

Matildas v Brazil - Game 1, CommBank Stadium, Parramatta
Gates open 18:15. Kick-off 19:45. Full-time 21:30
- The closest station to Commbank Stadium is Parramatta. Trains will operate to a regular timetable running to Parramatta every 10 to 15 minutes.
- The stadium is approximately 15 minutes walk from the station exiting via Darcy St then continuing on Church St, the Riverside Walk (non-accessible route) or through Prince Alfred Square to the stadium on O'Connell St.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events, homepage

due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Mortdale.

Some services may finish at / start from different locations. You may need to change trains to continue your journey.
due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Burwood earlier.

Sutherland due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Mortdale.

Some services may finish at / start from different locations. You may need to change trains to continue your journey. 

Increased journey times and larger than usual gaps to services may also be experienced. 

Please allow plenty of additional travel time, listen to announcements, check station information screens and transport apps before boarding trains.

Central due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Mortdale.

Some services may finish at / start from different locations. You may need to change trains to continue your journey.

Trains have been suspended between Moss Vale and Campbelltown in both directions due to severe weather conditions affecting infrastructure at various locations.

Bus companies are being contacted to provide a replacement service between Moss Vale and Campbelltown, Buses are expected to arrive at Moss Vale and Picton at approximately 8:30pm, however we have no forecast for buses at Campbelltown or the re opening of the rail line.

We recommend delaying your journey or making alternative arrangements. If you must travel please plan ahead, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for service updates

Increased journey times and larger than usual gaps to services may also be experienced. 

Please allow plenty of additional travel time, listen to announcements, check station information screens and transport apps before boarding trains.

The rear 4 carriages are unavailable due to an operational issue. Please board from the front 4 carriages.

From 5 October 2021 until 29 October 2021, escalator maintenance will be taking place at Kings Cross station. Please take care around the work area, follow directional signage at the station and speak to station staff if you require assistance.

From Sunday 17 October until Monday 20 December the lift from the concourse to platform 1 will be closed due to an upgrade. If you need lift access, catch a train from platform 3/4 for Metro access to North Shore stations or via Strathfield to the City. For help see stations staff or call 98478248.

The lift between the concourse and platform 5 is out of service until 22 November due to upgrade works.  For customers travelling to Ashfield from the city requiring lift, you may have to change at Burwood and catch a return service to Ashfield to complete your journey. If you require further assistance, please ask staff or phone 9752 8356.
The lift between the concourse and platforms 1/2 is out of service until 7 December due to upgrade works. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9752 8356.

The lift between the concourse and platform 1 will be out of service until the 15 December. If you require a lift you may need to travel to Hurstville for a return service to City. For assistance, please ask staff or call 9563 7273.
The lift between the concourse and Farrow Road is out of service. For assistance ask staff or call 4629 0721.

There are changes happening at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Access to certain areas of the station and platforms may mean using different stairs, escalators and lifts. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For detailed information please visit https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/6063489

From 4am Monday 18 October 2021 access to the lift on Platform 2 at Campsie will temporarily change due to Metro works.
Please take care when going to and from the lift on the platform.
Station Update - Berry, Bomaderry (Nowra), Kiama and more

Buses replace trains between Wollongong and Kiama in both directions due to an incident involving a train and a car at Kembla Grange station.

Trains between Port Kembla, Wollongong and the City continue to operate.

It is expected the line will reopen for the start of Monday morning train services so we recommend delaying your journey or making alternative travel arrangements. If you must travel please plan ahead and allow plenty of extra travel time, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for updates.
Station Update - Canterbury, Dulwich Hill, Hurlstone Park and more
Due to Metro construction works platforms have a reduced capacity. Please avoid standing in front of the construction zones and remain behind the yellow line on the platforms.
Due to station redevelopment work some platforms have reduced capacity. Please avoid standing in front of construction zones and remain behind the yellow line on the platform

The stairs from Richardsons Crescent to concourse are closed for maintenance work until November 2021. Access to platforms 2 and 3 is via platform 1 side entrance (off carpark on Richardsons Crescent). Entrance from Griffiths St is not affected.
Commuter parking has been reduced at Warwick Farm station until early 2022. For more information please see signage around the station or visit www.transport.nsw.gov.au/warwickfarm

From 4am Saturday 23 October to 4am Monday 8 November 2021 the southern entrance to Punchbowl Station (via The Boulevard or the car park) will be closed for Metro works.
Please use the northern entrance (via Punchbowl Road and Rest Park) for access into the station.

From Monday 27 September to Saturday 2 October the lift from Elizabeth Street into St James station will be closed for maintenance works. Please use Martin Place station if you require lift access during this period.
Commuter parking has been reduced at St Marys station. For more information please see signage around the station or visit www.transport.nsw.gov.au/stmarys

A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. 
While the concourse is being installed, please use the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. 
If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info

From 16 May until mid December 2021, the escalators to Exit 1 (Wynyard Park) will undergo upgrade works. Please follow the signs and staff directions to the nearest available stairs or lift. If you need assistance, see station staff.
